summary: The code file contains multiple not-implemented error handlers and lacks actual business logic implementation for the API operations.

issues.description: Function name 'not_implemented_error' does not follow PEP 8 naming conventions
issues.example: def not_implemented_error(operation_name: str) -> Tuple[Dict[str, Any], int]:

issues.description: Import statement for Error model should be at the top of the file
issues.recommendation: Move the import statement to the top of the file

issues.description: Code duplication for creating Error object in multiple handler functions
issues.recommendation: Create a helper function to generate Error objects
issues.example: def create_error(code: str, message: str, details: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:

strengths: Well-structured code with clear separation of handler functions
